text: @afneil Because all coverage of Covid-19 in the British press is hopelessly compromised. Where are the headlines about the highest per capita death rate in the world? Why so much about trailing USA and now Brazil, with their vastly greater populations?

domain.name: Person
domain.description: Named people in the world like Nelson Mandela

entity.name: Andrew Neil
entity.description: BBC journalist and broadcaster, chairman of Press Holdings Media Group, whose titles include The Spectator, and the ITP Media Group.
